snippet.title: BP resumes pumping mud in attempt to cap oil well
snippet.description:
* BP resumed pumping heavyweight drilling mud Friday in its attempt to cap a breached oil well in what the company's top executive described as an "environmental catastrophe."
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/05/28/gulf.oil.spill/index.html

snippet.title: How BP's 'top kill' procedure will work
snippet.description:
* BP's next attempt to stop the oil leak in the Gulf of Mexico will involve a maneuver called "top kill," in which heavy drilling fluid is to be pumped into the head of the leaking well at the seafloor.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/05/24/faq.top.kill.bp/index.html

snippet.title: BP says tube successfully inserted back into Gulf leak
snippet.description:
* Oil company BP says it has resumed pumping oil to a ship on the surface after a weekend setback that halted efforts to siphon off the crude spewing from a damaged well at the bottom of the Gulf of Mexico.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/05/16/gulf.oil.spill/index.html

snippet.title: BP: Focus is on killing well, not future drilling in Gulf
snippet.description:
* A BP official on Friday talked about the possibility of resuming drilling at the site of the Gulf oil disaster, but the company clarified his remarks.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/08/07/gulf.oil.static.kill/index.html

snippet.title: BP vows to share hard-fought well-killing expertise
snippet.description:
* As BP closes in on permanently sealing its crippled well in the Gulf of Mexico, it says it has learned from the disaster and will share that hard-fought knowledge with other oil companies and authorities around the world.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/08/06/bp.sharing.expertise/index.html

snippet.title: May take 10 days to cap abandoned, leaking well off Louisiana coast
snippet.description:
* An abandoned well struck by a barge in southeastern Louisiana early Tuesday is still spewing a mixture of oil, gas and water, and it could take 10 days before it is capped.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/07/29/louisiana.barataria.bay.leak/index.html

snippet.title: Leaking Barataria Bay oil well capped
snippet.description:
* An abandoned well in southeastern Louisiana that had spewed a mixture of oil, gas and water for nearly a week after being struck by a barge has been capped, officials said.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/08/02/louisiana.barataria.bay.leak/index.html

snippet.title: Landslide toll rises to 28 as searchers battle muck, standing water
snippet.description:
* Among the mounds of mud and ripped-down trees, you see an occasional appliance, a tire here and there, the twisted cables that used to be part of the telephone system. What you don't see are homes.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/01/us/washington-landslide/index.html

snippet.title: Landslide search: 'I don't think anything could prepare you'
snippet.description:
* Slogging through sometimes waist-deep mud, rescuers returned to the "unreal" scene of a deadly Cascade Mountain landslide Thursday with the grim expectation that more bodies waited underneath them.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/27/us/washington-landslide/index.html

snippet.title: No fresh signs of life in search after devastating Washington landslide
snippet.description:
* They've been at it for parts of five days, using excavators, shovels and their hands to scour stark, dirty, surreal remnants of a landslide that ripped through part of rural Snohomish County, Washington. The first goal: Locate any sign of life.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/26/us/washington-landslide/index.html
